git-commit.description: Commit changes to git and push to remote
git-commit.notes: Pull before commit if remote may have changed.

send-email.description: Send email to owner via agentmail.to API
send-email.notes: Write JSON to state/outbox/. Sync daemons deliver.

health-check.description: Run system health diagnostics via python3 core/health_check.py
health-check.notes: Checks imports, .env, state, git, claude CLI, actors, cron, agents, skills, telegram daemon.

inbox-processing.description: Read owner messages from responder mailbox, reply via outbox, escalate complex questions to brain
inbox-processing.notes: Router delivers to responder mailbox. Responder replies or escalates to brain.

actor-management.description: Spawn and manage sub-agents via Task tool, create worktrees for write agents, merge results
actor-management.notes: Write agents (builder/improver) need git worktrees. Read agents (researcher/auditor) work in v2/. Brain serializes all merges.

self-improvement.description: Run 10-cycle improvement loop: consolidate, audit, improve, merge, notify

verbose-output.description: Writing >500 tokens in autonomous mode wastes budget
verbose-output.mitigation: Be terse. Details in logs, not stdout.

acknowledge-without-executing.description: Creating a task number instead of doing the work
acknowledge-without-executing.mitigation: If the owner asks for something, do it now. Don't defer.

direct-coding.description: Brain writing code directly instead of delegating to sub-agents in worktrees
direct-coding.mitigation: Always spawn a builder/improver in an isolated worktree. Brain manages, doesn't code.

shared-session.description: Multiple actors sharing the same session causing lockouts and conflicts
shared-session.mitigation: Each actor owns its session. Responder is fully independent of brain.

recent_experiments.hypothesis: Inbox processing in controller enables real-time owner interaction
recent_experiments.result: success â€” gather_inbox, archive_inbox, prompt injection all added
